Class UserInterface

  • java.lang.Object
    • UserInterface

  • class UserInterface
extends java.lang.Object
    Project #1 CS 2334, Section 010 February 22, 2017

    This class provided helper methods to interact with the user.

    Note that all methods in this class are static because we don't need to make several UserInterface objects and have them maintain their own data. Instead, we simply need a collection of useful methods to create windows that pop up one at a time, are used, and then are discarded.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Dean Hougen

    • Method Detail

      • queryNewsMakerName

        public static java.lang.String queryNewsMakerName()
        This method asks the user for the name of a news maker using a JOptionPane and returns it.
        Returns:
        The name provided by the user (or "None" if none provided).

      • createListOfNewspaperStoriesForNewsmaker

        public static java.lang.String createListOfNewspaperStoriesForNewsmaker(NewsMaker newsMaker)
        This method takes a news maker and turns its list of newspaper stories into a string formated for display to the user. At the end it includes line summarizing the number of stories found, the number of different newspapers in which these stories were published, the total number of words in these articles, and the number of different topics found.
        Parameters:
        newsMaker - The news maker for which to create the story list as a string
        Returns:
        The list of stories as one (potentially very large) string

      • convertToOutputFormat

        private static java.lang.String convertToOutputFormat(NewspaperStory newspaperStory)
        This method converts an individual story to the desired display format.
        Parameters:
        newspaperStory - The story to convert to the display format.
        Returns:
        The story in the display format.

      • presentNewspaperStories

        public static void presentNewspaperStories(java.lang.String listOfStories,
                                           java.lang.String newsMakerName)
        This method displays the list of newspaper stories to the user using a JOptionPane.

        Note that a JOptionPane works fine for small messages but isn't suitable for large messages, such as those that can be generated for news makers for whom there are many stories. However, to keep this project relatively simple, we have gone with a JOptionPane here. We'll learn how to develop more suitable graphical user interfaces in later assignments.

        Parameters:
        listOfStories - The list of stories to display, all as one (potentially very large) String.
        newsMakerName - The name of the news maker (which is put into the title of the JOptionPane).
